column1: #Text=is a Scottish filmmaker best known as the director of the 2003 feature film American Cousins and for bringing the world of Katie Morag to the screen .

#Text=The successful translation of the characters from the books of Mairi Hedderwick has won nine awards - including a US Peabody , 3 BAFTAs , a Royal Television Society Scotland Children 's Award , a Scottish BAFTA and a Kidscreen award .
#Text=He is also a documentary and music filmmaker who has worked on numerous current affairs and entertainment productions , [ 1 ] including the late night discussion programme After Dark .
#Text=He was recognised for his achievements and contributions at the 2015 Scottish BAFTA Awards where he won the Best Director Award .
#Text=Don Coutts left school in 1967 , and began work with the Simon Community before moving to London .
#Text=Soon afterwards he was employed by Columbia Pictures as a clerk .
#Text=Following work in Columbia 's laboratories , he got a job in the studio 's cutting rooms and worked on several films as an assistant film editor .
#Text=Subsequently Coutts was employed by Anglia TV and BBC East as an assistant film editor .
#Text=As director of After Dark , Coutts developed an innovative televisual language of big close-ups , pulled focus and a panning system that was new to British talk show programming . [ 2 ]
